name: cfschedule
description:
Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling
 engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the
 option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This
 feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such
 as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is
 performed to populate the page.

params.name: action
params.description:
delete: deletes the specified task
 update: updates an existing task or creates a new task,
 if one with the name specified by the task attribute
 does not exist
 run: executes the specified task
 pause: Pauses the specified task.
 resume: Continues executing the specified task.
 list: Lists all the scheduled tasks.

params.name: task
params.description: Name of the task.

params.name: operation
params.description: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.

params.name: file
params.description:
Name of the file in which to store the published output of
 the scheduled task

params.name: path
params.description: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.

params.name: startdate
params.description: Date on which to first run the scheduled task.

params.name: starttime
params.description: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.

params.name: URL
params.description: URL of the page to execute.

params.name: port
params.description:
Port to use on the server that is specified by the url
 parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs
 that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to
 preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in
 the url attribute overrides this value.

params.name: publish
params.description:
Yes: save the result to a file
 No: does not

params.name: endDate
params.description: Date when scheduled task ends.

params.name: endTime
params.description: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).

params.name: interval
params.description:
Interval at which task is scheduled.
 * number of seconds (minimum is 60)
 * once
 * daily
 * weekly
 * monthly

params.name: requesttimeout
params.description: Deprecated as of CF11+ used to extend the default timeout period.

params.name: username
params.description: Username, if URL is protected.

params.name: password
params.description: Password, if URL is protected.

params.name: proxyserver
params.description: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

params.name: proxyport
params.description: Port number to use on the proxy server.

params.name: proxyuser
params.description: User name to provide to the proxy server.

params.name: proxypassword
params.description: Password to provide to the proxy server.

params.name: resolveurl
params.description:
Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute
 references
 No: does not

params.name: group
params.description: The group to which the scheduled task belongs.

params.name: mode
params.description: If the task is server-specific or application specific.

params.name: result (coldfusion)/returnvariable (lucee)
params.description: Name for the query in which cfschedule returns the result variables.

examples.title: Create or update a task
examples.description: Tell Coldfusion to run 'importData.cfm' daily at 7AM
examples.code:
<cfschedule
 action="update"
 task="importMyCSVFileToDB"
 operation="HTTPRequest"
 startDate="5/12/2016"
 startTime="7:00 AM"
 url="http://www.mydomain.com/scheduled/importData.cfm"
 interval="daily" />

examples.title: Delete a scheduled task
examples.description: Delete the task 'importMyCSVFileToDB' from the list of Coldfusion scheduled jobs
